subject: The International Monetary F
body:
The International Monetary Fund (IMF)
Office of Internal Audit and Inspection
Dear Sir,
It might be of interest to you to know that the IMF has eventually
intervened in your persistent payment failures after several reports
of irregularities and illegalities reached us.
After our investigation, we realized that there are interests from
some high-class persons, from private and government institutions,
that want your funds to end up in their offshore accounts. They are
the people undermining all the previous efforts to release your funds.
They used several methods, such as unnecessary demands of fees, among
other things, to frustrate and scare away beneficiaries to keep their
funds.
To stop this from reoccurring and achieve our objective, which is to
oversee your payment through, we are collaborating with several law
enforcement agencies, integrating some of their personnel with the
officials that are handling your funds' release in different
capacities to scrutinize the process and bring to justice those with
criminal intentions.
Responding to this notice, we request that you kindly re-confirm the
below-listed details for clarity's sake.
1) Your Full Name:
2) Your Address:
3) DOB:
4) Direct Phone Numbers:
5) Your Profession/Occupation:
6) Company (If there is any)
7) A copy of your DL, front, and back
I would appreciate a reply as soon as possible with the above request
to verify that you are the intended recipient and the rightful
beneficiary.
Regards,
Nancy Asiko Onyango
Director, Office of the Internal Audit and Inspection,
International Monetary Fund (IMF)

subject: Re:   The International Monetary F
body:
Dear Nancy Asiko Onyango,

Thank you for your email and the information provided. I appreciate the IMF's intervention in this matter. However, I would like to clarify a few things before providing my personal details.

Could you please provide more specific details about the persistent payment failures you mentioned? Also, could you elaborate on who these individuals are that are trying to divert my funds?

Once I have a clearer understanding of the situation, I will be more than happy to provide the necessary information.

Best wishes,
Jimmy
